Reviews.Title: A Very Nice Alternative
Reviews.Author: Joel B. Reed "Author, Jazz Phillips Mystery s...
Reviews.Content: Ever since I started using a Canon camera (the old F model of the late Sixties), I have followed the rule that it is better to spend one's money on good glass than slightly better body quality. I chose this model over the XSi because of the price difference. The two megapixels more was not worth the $155.00 extra to me, and a year of use confirms my decision. As does the comparison by Bob Atkins. The dollars I saved went to buying a 7D this year, a major body quality upgrade, and the dollars saved from buying that rather than a 5D are going toward another first class lens. Make no mistake, this is a first class camera for almost any kind of photography. It is five star quality all the way across the board, and I recommend it highly to anyone on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Christy Girl "Christy Girl"
Reviews.Content: I was informed to buy this camera without a lens because the lenses available to purchase are much better.  I bought the 50mm lens, and it is great.  I suggest buying some sort of zoom lens though because you will want to be able to zoom in and zoom out.

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS Rebel - Body Only
Reviews.Author: Janelle Poore
Reviews.Content: I had previously had a Canon EOS (non-digital) and still had lenses that I wanted to use. My old lenses fit this new digital camera perfect. Still learning how to take better pictures, but with this Canon EOS Rebel I think I am on my way to being a better photographer.

Reviews.Title: Works like a charm
Reviews.Author: Jose Toledo Rodriguez "rtoledo"
Reviews.Content: This camera is exactly what I was looking for, works perfect with my Canon lenses and performs even better than my old film Canon EOS Rebel. I will be using it for a long time, although the 10.1 MP won't be enough soon. I'm using it with an EF-S 10-22mm f/3.5-4.5 USM wide angle lens and an EF-S 18-200mm f/3.5-5.6 IS zoom lens. Both work accurately and fast

Reviews.Title: Canon Digital Rebel XS
Reviews.Author: Mark D. Wilson
Reviews.Content: The Digital Rebel XS is one of the best values offered in the realm of SLR cameras today.  Although it doesn't offer the degree of control that is available on pro or prosumer cameras, the image quality is very good so it makes a great camera for the casual user.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: MK "mk13books"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, but the reviews were right about the auto focus not being very good. I deal with it because an upgrade would have been much more expensive. Great features, easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great starter DSLR
Reviews.Author: Sabrina Clark
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I use it on a daily basis at home and also for my professional needs. It's a perfect starter DSLR. Very inexpensive and also easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Meets expectations
Reviews.Author: SilentWarfare86
Reviews.Content: Met all expectations. The camera goes with me everywhere and has been put to the test. Good product and good quality being that it was a used camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent starter camera, it has served me well.
Reviews.Author: Austin
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a few years ago for my high school class, we were moving from film and the darkroom and into the digital realm. My P&S; wasn't cutting it so this was the next step. I have been happy with my results for quite some time, the quality, the clarity, everything. I love having the ability to use EF and EF-S lenses, I recently added the 24-105 L lens and have had stunning results.That being said, I'm getting more serious into photography and am looking to finally upgrade the body of my arsenal.Overall, I have been very happy with this camera, it was easy to get the hang of, it takes excellent pictures, and it was very lightweight. I highly recommend it to anyone getting into photography or for anyone who is just looking for a step up from their Point & Shoot.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera for Deep Space Astrophotography
Reviews.Author: B. D. Prince "babyvett"
Reviews.Content: My husband bought this camera (body only) to use for deep space Astrophotography. The camera is very easy to use - even those without experience with a DSLR camera (those like my husband) should easily be able to figure out how to use it and be able to take great photographs straight out of the box. We haven't used the camera for regular photography as of yet (I'm still looking at and debating various lenses) but I have no doubt that it will take excellent quality photographs as we have had great results with deep space images.

Reviews.Title: perfect for me
Reviews.Author: amy everett
Reviews.Content: This camera is everything i need and works great.  The auto setting works great for almost everything but the manual settings are very easy as well.  The camera is light enough to take anywhere w/ just the strap.  I did end up ordering a zoom lens from Amazon but it was a Tamaron.  I would recommend this to any amateur that wants better than just point and click.

Reviews.Title: I Love It  !!!!
Reviews.Author: Mark E. Cowart
Reviews.Content: Thank you so much for your rapid mailing and also for the camera.  My daughter loves it!! She was so excited because she had a baby on Sept 30, 2012.  He is first baby and first grandchild.  She needed to take bunches and bunches of pictures.Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: The XS is amazing!
Reviews.Author: Beau
Reviews.Content: This thing has taken amazing photos. After you get to a certain number of megs, your eye really can't see the difference in the same photo taken by this camera and a higher res camera. By then, it depends on the lens and the person taking the picture. People say it's a good entry level camera, which it is because it's user friendly, but it also works as a lower medium level camera. If you get this camera as a first DSLR, you can keep it with you for a while. The only time I would ever tell someone not to get it is if they really want to take videos with it. If that's the case, consider looking at the canon rebels with 'T' in the front of it's name. (examples are: T1i, T2i, T3, T3i, or of you have a high budget, the T4i that just came out...)

Reviews.Title: Great Starter Camera
Reviews.Author: Marisa Smith
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to get into photography but didn't have much of a budget to do so, so after a photography friend's recommendation, I purchased this camera with high hopes. It is fantastic. The first few weeks I had it, I took it everywhere with me. It gets clean and crisp shots and because it doesn't take video, the battery seems to last forever! Yeah, it's not a super high-end camera with all the bells and whistles, but this is a great starter camera for someone wanting to get into photography.

Reviews.Title: A great starter DSLR; took some of the best pictures of my life with this
Reviews.Author: Robin H.
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of the Canon Rebel XS. It's the first DSLR I ever owned. I first bought one for my parents; after using it, I liked it so much I bought one for myself.I ended up getting the body only because I wanted to try other lenses. I got a Canon f1.8/50mm lens, and a Tamron 17-55mm/f2.8 lens. Both lenses are good enough to take any type of regular photograph.The build quality is great. It has a solid construction and it seems like it can handle lots of rough handling. Use common sense obviously; don't drop the thing! But I'm not worried about throwing it in a book bag or suitcase to take with me.The ISO is not as good as some of the higher end cameras. Night photos all look grainy; I have to edit the noise out using Adobe Lightroom.This camera has everything you need if you want to start learning photography.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value!!
Reviews.Author: Scott S.
Reviews.Content: I bought the Rebel XS as my first entry into the "DSLR" world at the advise of a friend....I couldn't be happier! This camera does everything (and more) that a rookie photog needs it to do, and the picture quality is far and above what I got with my Nikon 8mp point and shoot. I've probably taken several hundred shots already, and I still haven't had a need to charge the battery....in one word, this camera is "amazing". My next purchase--a 35 or 50 mm prime lens....Scott

Reviews.Title: AWESOME CAMERA
Reviews.Author: A. Terry "Angie"
Reviews.Content: I WAS VERY PLEASED WITH THE QUALITY OF THIS CAMERA!!!!!  I RECEIVED MY CAMERA ONE DAY EARLY THAN WHAT EXPECTED.  AWESOME SERVICE!

Reviews.Title: Great company to deal with
Reviews.Author: Connie J. Whitaker
Reviews.Content: Ordered a Canon Xs meaning to order XSI.  Arrived as ordered & very hospitable about return. No restocking charge.

Reviews.Title: Very great starter.
Reviews.Author: Phillip G. Pahl
Reviews.Content: I bought this body but instead of canons kit lens, I added a Sigma 18-50mm f/3.5-5.6 DC kit lens to my list. Have to say I love it, the options are easy to use. Battery life on this is very great, I'm able to go all day with a fully charged battery the body can't say much being this my first dslr but without all the bells and whistles it is a very great way to start off on a dslr.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Denise M. Baird
Reviews.Content: I got this camera a few weeks ago and it took great photos on the cruise I went on and it takes great photos of my kids.

Reviews.Title: Back in the Photography groove
Reviews.Author: Ricky Cash
Reviews.Content: When I discovered that 10 - 12 megapixels were all that's needed to make photos up to 11x14. I decided to try this camera body out.  It takes great photos even for my novice wife who loves photos but hates complicated photo equipment.

Reviews.Title: Camera is wonderful when it works.
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing camera. I bought it thinking that my lenses from a film camera would work.  They did not.  The return date had passed when I finaly got a lens and starte shooting.  It will take 3 or 4 shots and then I get an error 99 and have to remove the battey.  Would not buy from this dealer again.

Reviews.Title: Kind of a waste of money (for me).
Reviews.Author: Spurdy
Reviews.Content: I have a Canon XTi, and I love it. Its pop-up flash broke years ago, and because I use an external flash now, it kind of takes the convenience out of a digital SLR with a popup. So I figured I'd get a new body and use my Canon lens and all would be right with the world. But this camera sometimes worked (as in simply turned on), but sometimes didn't. Sometimes it'd take photos but sometimes it wouldn't. I had to shoot my brother's wedding, and it's a darn good thing I had my old XTi, which saved the day. I sent the body back to Canon, and they fixed the on-off problem, but I still have a lot of trouble with poor lighting and bad focusing -- I don't have those problems with my old Canon, so I try not to think it's user error. Generally, I wish I hadn't bought this camera, but I didn't return it quickly enough and am stuck with a $400 mistake.

Reviews.Title: HUGE problems expiensive to fix!!!
Reviews.Author: shellcanada
Reviews.Content: I have a canon rebel eos xs had it for almost 3 yrs used it almost everyday.I noticed on my last shoot for a family that it was lagging constantly saying busy .....never thought too too much about it WELL I should have because next time went to use it I have nothing at all keeps saying busy in view finder and will not snap a photo at all!! I have nothing on the display screen!! I have checked with a variety of camera shops to fix it and the lowest price was $400 bucks , well I can buy a brand new higher model for a couple hundred more!!! and the xs sells for under $400 now!!! when I did my research seemed like a WHOLE lot of people were having this same problem with this model of canon camera !!! You would think CANON would offer some sort of help but they do not...would I buy another canon well seeming how I have over $1500 bucks of lenses and flashes I kinda have to but it will be a higher model...I received this one as a Christmas gift ,doubt highly Santa will be kind this year..lol....I would suggest making sure your camera firmware is always up to date !!! and check before purchasing a canon rebel eos xs!!!!

Reviews.Title: Canon XS woot!
Reviews.Author: Aaron Nunez
Reviews.Content: I got this because I'm a starting photographer, along with the 50mm this camera is insane. I liked the controls on the olympus e-520 a little better, but got the hang of this. Don't like that the scroll wheel is next to the shutter button, if it were like the Nikon or the Olympus where you can scroll with your thumb i think it would be faster to change speed & aperture. noticed the LCD screen is clearer than the olympus, but it seems sorta dim to me in daylight. i like that the anti-dust feature turns on when you shut it off to not slow down turn on time. portability obviously not good cuz its a big dslr, but i gave it 4 stars anyway because its lighter than my old film camera and just as solidly built. Grip was my main concern, not really comfy and doesn't allow as firm a grip as nikon d3000 or olympus e520. those cameras feel like they were designed for the contours of your hand. Still, you could hold this with greasy hands, unlike those crappy slippery plasticky Pentax cameras that feel like those used up sweaty playstation controls at walmart. the buttons and layout of this camera remind me of the original xbox controller, it looks cool but when you try to use it its uncomfortable, sorta hurts, and you find that the shape of the buttons does not go well with the shape of your fingers or hand. I ultimately settled on this XS because Olympus has limited lenses, and i can't afford any of them. The nikon d3000 although equally priced, has no live view or anti shake. regardless, im glad with my purchase, gave it 4 stars cuz it looks really cool but its actually kinda uncomfortable, the button layout once again focuses on aesthetics and looking cool, but could be more functional (thumb scroll wheel anyone?) it only uses SD cards so might be bad for ppl who want fast RAW photos. for JPEG though it is very fast. anti shake automatically turns on when you focus a picture. didn't get the stock lens kit cuz i heard it sucks, but supposedly the newer IS version is way better than the old one, but i got the 50mm for this and it is crazy good. The fact that there are so many canon-fags out there kissing up to canon means i will find lots of used lenses for this. Anyway, respect to all cameras, they all have their ups and downs, but ultimately the canon had the most features for me, and lots of lenses means i can luckily find a cheap used one.

ProductInfo.Features:
Canon 10.1-megapixel CMOS sensor
3 fps continuous shooting, to over 500 full-resolution JPEGs or 5 RAW images in a burst
2.5-inch LCD Monitor with Live View Function
Advanced & Adaptable AF System
You will receive the original Canon manufacturer's kit box with only the 18-55mm lens removed. It includes ALL original camera accessories
ProductInfo.Name: Canon EOS Rebel XS 10.1-Megapixel Digital SLR Camera - Black (Body Only)
